DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: TORRISI, N. M.;Torrisi, Nunzio Marco;TORRISI, N.M.;TORRISI, NUNZIOMARCO;Torrisi, Nunzio;NUNZIO MARCO TORRISI

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Nunzio Marco Torrisi gradouce e recebeu o PhD em "Ingegneria Informatica e delle Telecomunicazioni" na "UniversitaД degli Studi di Catania", na Italia, no 2002 e no 2006 respectivamente. No 2001 ganhou o primeiro lugar na prova pratica ISA e o segundo lugar no ISA Bowl durante a competiчуo internacional de estudantes ISA no no Texas, EUA. No 2002 participou do programa de intercambio estudantil com a SUAI University em Sao Pietroburgo, Russia. No 2004 foi socio fundador da empresa TraceIT srl especializada em rastreamento software de produчуo alimentar. Desde o 2005 ele membro do International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC), Technical Committee SC65C, Working Group 12, "Functional Safety for Fieldbus". Do 2005 atщ 2008, ele foi bolsista FAPESP de pos doutorado dentro do departamento de engenharia de produчуo junto ao laboratorio de otimizacчуo de processo (OPF) dentro da Escola de Engenharia de Sуo Carlos (EESC) na Universidade de Sуo Paulo (USP), onde foi tambem referente para so projetos de controle remoto pela rede KyaTera. Desde o 2009, ele щ professor adjunto na Universidade Federal do ABC in Sуo Paulo (UFABC), onde leciona principalmente Redes de Computadores e Informatica Industrial. Ele orientou um pos doutorado em engenharia quimica in aplicacoes industrial para otimizacao de producao de biodiesel. Atualmente esta orientando tres estudantes no mestrado da engenharia da informacao e da computacao dentro da UFABC. Ele registrou uma patente, registro INPI 018070047508 No 2013, ele esta desenvolvendo junto com a SAAB Technologies e a Royal Technologies de Estocolmo um projeto de pesquisa sobre CyberSecurity para protocolos de monitoramento de distribuicao de energia.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Nunzio Marco Torrisi received the Master degree and the Ph.D. in Computer Engineering from the University of Catania, Italy, in 2002 and 2006, respectively. In 2001 he awarded the First place ISA Pratical and Second place ISA Bowl at ISA 2001 International Student Competition, USA. In 2002 he participated to ISA Student Exchange program at SUAI University, St. Petersburg, Russia. In 2004 he founded in Italy TraceIT s.r.l. a private company specialized in food traceability software. Since 2005, he has been a member of the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC), Technical Committee SC65C, Working Group 12, Functional Safety for Fieldbus. From 2005 to 2008, he was a FAPESP postdoctoral scholar at University of Sуo Paulo (USP), Brazil, with the Nucleus of Advanced Manufacture (NUMA) and the Manufacturing Process Optimization group (OPF), where he was responsible for remote control projects over the KyaTera network. Since January 2009, he has been an associate professor at the Federal University of ABC in Sуo Paulo (UFABC), Brazil, where he is currently teaching Computer Networks and Industrial Informatics. He supervised a chemical engineering postdoctoral in industrial biodiesel production optimization and another in computer science in streaming protocol for monitoring applications. He is orienting three students in computer science master degree and one in engineering of information at UFABC. He registered a Brazilian patent(INPI register number 018070047508) and published his work in international journals as ?IEEE Industrial Electronic Magazine? and ?International Journal of Manufacturing Technologies - Springer?. He reviewed papers for IEEE Industrial Informatics Transaction and Springer Computer and Electronic. He is IEEE and ISA member since 2005 and he was member of OPC Foundation in 2010. Nunzio speaks Italian, English, Portoguese and he is studying Swedish at the SFI school. He is researching at KTH Communication Networks Laboratory (LCN) in cyber-security for industrial protocols over IP networks with the scholarship of the SwB program. His commitment in R&D for computer technologies includes also the development of open standard as the CyberOPC project (www.cyberopc.org) and the strong relation with private industry to provide simple solutions with innovative research. Currently, he is developing with SAAB a research activity on CyberSecurity and the use of SPDY protocol applied to power systems communication system to improve the resilience to network failures of Inter-Control Center Communication (ICCC) reducing the risk of denial of service (DoS) attacks . The project explores the vulnerabilities of the SCADA protocols as OPC, OPC-UA, DNP and IEC 870-5-101 under encrypted tunnels using IPSec. The expected results could be used in order to define a gateway appliance product for process control over public IP networks. This also could permit to plug power systems device, meters and generic IED into the secure gateways placed at the edge of the public network. The data exchanged by that gateways to the remote SCADA will be protected by secure streams multiplexed using scheduling algorithms over other streams processed in the public IP networks.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CyberOPC An Open,Fast and Secure Communication System for Remote control dedicated to Industrial Application over TCP-IP applied to KyaTera network
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The communication solution, outlined in this project is proposed as the called CyberOPC Project. It includes the study and the realization of a new open protocol for the remote control of industrial systems, which in our study case are machinery CNC, satisfying the time-critical and cyber security requirements. The KyaTera network of the FASPESP/TIDIA Program (Tecnologia da Informaчуo no Desenvolvimento da Internet Avanчada) represents an important and technologically unique opportunity for the experimentation of the protocols and the methodologies for remote process control since the requirements for speed and bandwidth management in this project. The preliminary study and the initial results of the CyberOPC project have been developed at NUMA, Nњcleo de Manufatura Avanчada, during a six months research stage. The author of this project studied the basis of this problem during his PhD, which has been developed partially at NUMA in collaboration with the University of Catania. The described plan, in synthesis, will arrange already famous methodologies and new approaches of the Computer Networks and Cyber Security in order to develop a new protocol of transport for data process with the following goals: (i) to minimize the delays of transmission for time-critical control data; (ii) to guarantee the security of the used communication channel; (iii) to guarantee integrity and confidentiality of the transmitted control data.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Novas tecnologias de streaming para controle remoto dedicado para aplicaчѕes industriais sobre redes IP pњblicas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Os principais objetivos do projeto sуo: - Controlar, a estimatar os limites da rede e a demora entre dois pontos CyberOPC em redes com largura de banda reservada; - Plugar dispositivos industriais em redes pњblicas com largura de banda reservada e testar programas de controle remotamente. - Criar algoritmos de controle distribuэdo sobre conexѕes lѓgicas laboratѓrios em redes pњblicas sem precisar de VPNs; - Descentralizar a parte de business intelligence ao longo de uma rede IP pњblica mantendo distante o chуo de fabrica de uma empresa de manufatura; - Comparar e analisar simultaneamente processos remotos do mesmo tipo mas geograficamente distante; - Pesquisar e desenvolver mщtodos de inteligъncia artificial para anсlise de dados online remoto (Computaчуo nas nuvens). - Em um cenсrio de fсbricas distribuэdas geograficamente e poder criar um ponto de acesso que disponibiliza recursos para treino a distтncia.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Os principais objetivos do projeto sуo: - Controlar, a estimatar os limites da rede e a demora entre dois pontos CyberOPC em redes com largura de banda reservada; - Plugar dispositivos industriais em redes pњblicas com largura de banda reservada e testar programas de controle remotamente. - Criar algoritmos de controle distribuэdo sobre conexѕes lѓgicas laboratѓrios em redes pњblicas sem precisar de VPNs; - Descentralizar a parte de business intelligence ao longo de uma rede IP pњblica mantendo distante o chуo de fabrica de uma empresa de manufatura; - Comparar e analisar simultaneamente processos remotos do mesmo tipo mas geograficamente distante; - Pesquisar e desenvolver mщtodos de inteligъncia artificial para anсlise de dados online remoto (Computaчуo nas nuvens). - Em um cenсrio de fсbricas distribuэdas geograficamente e poder criar um ponto de acesso que disponibiliza recursos para treino a distтncia.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CyberOPC - Um sistema de comunicaчуo aberto, rсpido e seguro para controle remoto dedicado para aplicaчѕes industriais sobre redes IP publicas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Varias tecnologias de comunicaчуo existentes jс sуo adotadas hoje para redes pњblicas e nуo, como Internet e Intranet. Sendo a maioria das aplicaчѕes industriais tempo-criticas, os requisitos dos sistemas de comunicaчуo para controle remoto sуo diferentes daqueles das aplicaчѕes comuns para redes de computadores usadas na Internet como Web, e-mail e file transfer. Alщm disso, junto com os requisitos para trafego tempo-critico, os requisitos de safety e cyber-security devem ser considerados quando o controle remoto щ construэdo acima de redes pњblicas como Internet. A soluчуo de comunicaчуo apresentada neste projeto щ nomeada CyberOPC. Ela inclui o estudo e a realizaчуo de um novo protocolo aberto para controle remoto de sistemas industriais. O projeto continua a linha de pesquisa do trabalho de Pѓs Doc (PROCESSO No. 2006/52322-8) interrompido no final de Janeiro do 2009 porque o bolsista de Pѓs Doc Nunzio Marco Torrisi assumiu o cargo de professor adjunto de redes de comunicaчѕes (em dedicaчуo exclusiva) na Universidade Federal do ABC(UFABC). Por esta razуo o bolsista pediu o cancelamento da bolsa. O projeto proposto estende o foco em aplicaчѕes industriais, no uso do protocolo aplicativo CyberOPC para dispositэvos embarcados e no eventual desenvolvimento de patentes. O plano de projeto descrito, em sэntese, combina metodologias bem reconhecidas e novas abordagens de redes de computadores e cyber security para melhorar o processamento dos dados de processo do protocolo CyberOPC.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Various communication technologies already adopted exist today for public and non-public networks as Internet and Intranet. Since the most of the industrial applications are time-critical, the requirements of communication systems for remote control are different from the common applications for computer networks used in Internet like Web, e-mail and file transfer. Moreover, together with the requirements for time-critical traffic, the requirements safety and cyber security must be considered when the remote control is built over public networks like Internet. The communication solution, outlined in this project, is called CyberOPC. It includes the study and the realization of a new open protocol for the remote control of industrial systems. This project keeps the PhD fellowship research project(PROCESSO No. 2006/52322-8) interrupted at the end of January 2009 because the Post PhD scholarship holder Nunzio Marco Torrisi has get a position at Universidade Federal do ABC(UFABC) as professor of communication networks in the course of information engineer. For such reason the scholarship holder has requested the end of the scholarship. The proposed project extends the focuses on the industrial applications, the use of the CyberOPC application protocol for embedded device and the eventual issued patents. The described plan, in synthesis, will arrange already famous methodologies and new approaches of the Computer Networks and Cyber Security in order to enhance the CyberOPC protocol for data process with the following goals: (i) to bound the delays of transmission for time-critical control data; (ii) to study the modeling the application protocol be portable in PLCs.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: CyberOPC - Um sistema de comunicaчуo aberto, rсpido e seguro para controle remoto dedicado para aplicaчѕes industriais sobre redes IP publicas
